intro: Combretum collinum subsp. taborense, commonly known as the mountain flame bush, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features include lanceolate leaves with prominent veins and small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate dry conditions.
